Package com.memoable.backend.controller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.memoable.backend.controller.UserController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/user")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for catching REST requests for creating and deleting users
    Author:
    Jere Salmensaari

      • findByName

        @GetMapping("/{name}")
public User findByName​(@PathVariable

      • createUser

        @PostMapping
public java.lang.String createUser​(@RequestBody
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> body)
        Creates a user into the database

        If username is already in use, returns "unameErr". If username or password fields are empty returns null

        Parameters:
        body - User object in JSON form
        Returns:
        username and user's id, null if fields are missing or unameErr if username is in use

      • deleteUser

        @DeleteMapping("/delete/{id}")
public java.lang.Boolean deleteUser​(@RequestHeader
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> headers,
                                    @PathVariable
                                    java.lang.String id)
        Deletes a user corresponding to the given id

        Must have a valid token matching to the user's ID in the headers as a Bearer token

        Parameters:
        headers - Headers of the Http request
        id - id of the user to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if user is deleted, otherwise false

      • parseJWT

        private java.lang.Boolean parseJWT​(java.lang.String token,
                                   java.lang.String id)
        Parses a JWT token and checks if the token's user matches the given id
        Parameters:
        token - JWT token to parse
        id - User id to compare the token to
        Returns:
        True if id's match, otherwise false
